content.description: I want to Rock attacks the steep overhang. Great obvious line and good holds up through the overhang. Crux comes from pulling through the last part of the bulge and mantling to the top. Rare to find overhanging problems with good holds and rock. Get on this one either as a warm up or when exiting mount baldy via the camp Judson rd.
content.protection: good landing crash pad or two is nice
content.location: Heading towards Irie Heights you will cross down a small gully in which another path will appear going east to west. Turn left and follow this path west as it slowly meanders down hill. After about 5-10 minutes looking to your left. You should see this huge elongated boulder

content.description: Crux may be dropping into face holds off lipper. cool all body problem. Nice and low fun many options
content.location: Starts lookers right just beyond the top out dish & horn of the left to right traverse. This starts on some crystals over the lip right beyond the bigger rounded horn like feature (in photo). A heel hook starts this, climb lip/face left and top out on holds near the only wide vertical crack. Many variations done by many people.

content.description: A great place to start or end the day. a finger friendly outcropping.    Im sure someone has more info than me I just have the shots.
